subject: Law
title: The Bill of Rights: First Ten Amendments
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Bill of Rights: First Ten Amendments.

hook.text: The Constitution almost wasn't ratified. Anti-Federalists demanded explicit rights protections. They got ten.

buildup.text: The Bill of Rights (1791) added ten amendments guaranteeing individual liberties against federal government overreach.

discovery.text: Free speech, religion, press, assembly, bear arms, no unreasonable searchesâ€”these became foundational American law.

twist.text: Originally, the Bill of Rights limited only the federal government. The 14th Amendment extended it to the states.

climax.text: Through incorporation, the Supreme Court applied most Bill of Rights protections to the states over decades.

punchline.text: Ten amendments. Two centuries of interpretation. The debate never stopped.

quiz.question: What process applied the Bill of Rights to state governments?
